abstract: The business software firm recorded some of its sharpest quarterly growth in a decade, easing fears it would be bruised by the mortgage crisis.
snippet: The business software firm recorded some of its sharpest quarterly growth in a decade, easing fears it would be bruised by the mortgage crisis.
lead_paragraph: The Oracle Corporation, the business software company, reported a sharp rise in new licenses on Wednesday, soundly beating Wall Street’s projections for the second quarter.

headline.main: Oracle Beats Wall Street’s Expectations for Quarter
headline.print_headline: Oracle Beats Wall Street’s Expectations For Quarter
